bibl.title: Charles Lind v. John F. Sheehan and H.G. Thornton. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Port Townsend Jefferson County Washington Territory
In the matter of the application of Charles Lind of King County for a Washington Territory for a Writ of Habeas Corpus --

To John F. Sheehan Sheriff and Jefferson County, W.T. + H.G. Thornton-- Whereas it has been alleged on oath before the Honorable Roger S. Greene Judge of the above named Court on petiton for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, that you have in your custody the person of Charles Lind
illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty at Port Townsend Jefferson County Washington Territory
Now therefore in the name of the United States of America you are hereby commanded taht you have the body of the said Charles Lind.
before the Hon. Roger S. Greene at the Court room of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory at Port Townsend

Jefferson County W.T. on the 24th day of August A.D. 1885 at 4 o'clock P.M. that due may be made into the cause and legality of said restraint, and that you then and there make due return to this writ in the manner required by law
Witness the Hon. Roger S. Greene Judge of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory this 24th day of August AD 1885
In the matter of the application of Charles Lind for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
